main event: On 3 September 1952, three unidentified flying objects were observed in Dublin, Georgia, moving slowly at high altitude and changing direction abruptly.
interesting points: The objects were first seen moving from west to east before changing direction 90 degrees to the north., Observers described the objects as elongated and luminous, resembling flaming flying saucers., The objects maintained a steady altitude and did not make any noticeable sounds or vibrations., The sighting lasted for about 15 minutes and included reports from multiple witnesses., Weather conditions were clear with visibility reported at 11 miles.
witness description: Mrs. Irma Warne observed the objects while working in her garden.
